intro: Ornithogalum orthophyllum subsp. baeticum, commonly known as the Baetican star-of-Bethlehem, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its erect, slender stems and clusters of white, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, and it is often found in mountainous regions. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and ecological significance in its native habitat.
